definitions: a small North American freshwater catfish that has a venom gland at the base of the pectoral fin spines, with which it can inflict a painful wound.

notes.text: Genus Noturus, family Ictaluridae: numerous species, including the common tadpole madtom (N. gyrinus)

shortDefinitions: small North American freshwater catfish which has venom gland at base of pectoral fin spines
